headline: KeyBanc downgrades Adobe and ServiceNow on AI risks

headline: iRobot files for bankruptcy, ServiceNow to acquire Armis for $7B
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Roomba maker iRobot (IRBT) filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, ServiceNow (NOW) reportedly preparing to acquire Armis in a $7 billion deal, and Texas Instruments (TXN) receiving a double downgrade to Sell by Goldman Sachs analysts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: iRobot files for bankruptcy, ServiceNow to acquire Armis for $7B
content.description:
Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Roomba maker iRobot (IRBT) filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, ServiceNow (NOW) reportedly preparing to acquire Armis in a $7 billion deal, and Texas Instruments (TXN) receiving a double downgrade to Sell by Goldman Sachs analysts.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Roomba maker iRobot (IRBT) filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, ServiceNow (NOW) reportedly preparing to acquire Armis in a $7 billion deal, and Texas Instruments (TXN) receiving a double downgrade to Sell by Goldman Sachs analysts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: ServiceNow Reportedly Close To $7 Bil M&A Deal. Stock Falls.
summary: ServiceNow is reportedly close to a $7 billion acquisition deal for a cybersecurity startup. ServiceNow stock fell sharply Monday morning. KeyBanc also downgraded the shares. ServiceNow is in talks to buy Armis in a deal that could be announced in coming days, Bloomberg reported Saturday, citing unnamed sources.

content.title: ServiceNow Reportedly Close To $7 Bil M&A Deal. Stock Falls.
content.summary: ServiceNow is reportedly close to a $7 billion acquisition deal for a cybersecurity startup. ServiceNow stock fell sharply Monday morning. KeyBanc also downgraded the shares. ServiceNow is in talks to buy Armis in a deal that could be announced in coming days, Bloomberg reported Saturday, citing unnamed sources.

headline: ServiceNow completes acquisition of Moveworks
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., December 15, 2025--ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW), the AI control tower for business reinvention, today announced it has completed its acquisition of Moveworks. The acquisition advances ServiceNow’s vision to put AI to work for people, combining ServiceNow’s trusted agentic AI and intelligent workflows with Moveworks’ intuitive front-end AI assistant, enterprise search, and agentic Reasoning Engine. Together, the companies will expand the capabilities of the ServiceNow AI Platform t

content.title: ServiceNow completes acquisition of Moveworks
content.summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., December 15, 2025--ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW), the AI control tower for business reinvention, today announced it has completed its acquisition of Moveworks. The acquisition advances ServiceNow’s vision to put AI to work for people, combining ServiceNow’s trusted agentic AI and intelligent workflows with Moveworks’ intuitive front-end AI assistant, enterprise search, and agentic Reasoning Engine. Together, the companies will expand the capabilities of the ServiceNow AI Platform t
